snippet: Angry skirmishes over convictions by a war crimes tribunal entered another day, with several deaths.
abstract: Bangladesh has another day of bloodshed as at least 19 people die in angry skirmishes between police and supporters of country's biggest Islamist political party, Jamaat-e-Islami, over convictions by a war crimes tribunal; latest violence seems certain to deepen already bitter tensions between country's leading political parties.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Jim Yardley from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Angry skirmishes over convictions by a war crimes tribunal entered another day, with several deaths.

headline.seo: Deadly Day in Bangladesh as Protests Persist
headline.main: At Least 19 Killed as Unrest Persists in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: At Least 19 Are Killed as Unrest Persists in Bangladesh

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
